intro: Artocarpus refractus, commonly known as the rough-leaf breadfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and small, clustered fruits. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruits, which are edible when ripe, have a mild, sweet flavor and are used in various culinary applications. The plant is also valued for its ornamental leaves, which add visual interest to gardens and landscapes.
